issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

components.name: Query Processor
components.description: Tracks issues dealing with query processing.

fields.description:
With dynamic partition insert, user should follow the syntax as specified in: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/DynamicPartitions.

However, this is purely enforced on the user side, and there's no checking in Hive. As result, this could cause unexpected results for user queries, or confusing error messages.

I think we need to display information about which input column is used as DP column.
fields.summary: Report error when dynamic partition insert is not following the correct syntax

This message is automatically generated.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12728836 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Hi [~ctang.ma], can you take a look at this patch and see if it makes sense? Thanks.

[~csun] IMO, the patch definitely makes sense since we have seen a lot of escalations related to this kind of user error. Logging the mapping between src table columns and dynamic partition columns will help diagnose the user error. 
But sometimes the columns in inputRR might not necessarily have real names, they have internal generated names instead (e.g. _c10). In this case, it might not be much useful.
[~ctang.ma] Thanks a lot for the comment. I'll see what we can do for those internal names..
